Fields.DialogueText: Sneak attack!
Haha! Capitano, are you really trying to scare me? I saw you coming from a mile away.
How? I thought I had you there.
I've always got my eye on you. What's got you in such a playful mood anyway? Not that I'm complaining.
I'll admit, I'm a little excited about our new special assignment. We're escorting Senatore Giovanni to a conference to discuss the Morganas. It's pretty important.
He must be someone pretty special if he's going. I hear all the world leaders are attending.
You talk like you don't know who he is.
I know his name, not much else. I've never been one for politics, really.

Fields.MenuText: Senatore Giovanni! And you call yourself Italian.
Yeah, I've never cared much for politics either. Too depressing.
Up until I was eleven, I thought "politics" meant "many ticks." Like in a clock.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm plenty Italian. Italy is more than one man with an important job.
Exactly. I'd rather enjoy myself with Nicolina.
... Bwahahaha! Are you serious? That's hilarious! I love that! Poly-ticks, hahahaha!
*ALARM*
Looks like we'll have to talk about politics later. We've got incoming.
And the day was looking so nice, too.
@BATTLE
Capitano, It looks like we have a surprise visitor!
A visitor? Who?
None other than Capitano Lorenzo himself! He says he's here to congratulate you on your victory.
He wants to congratulate me? You sure he's not just disappointed about his loss?
He seemed genuine in his approval. He doesn't seem like a bad man.
You're usually spot on in your assessments. Send him in.
Capitano.
Did I just hear that Lorenzo is here? The same Lorenzo that made Fiorenza go nutso-crazy? I gotta see this guy!
The very same. I'm more than a little interested to see him myself.
Greetings! I'm Capitano Lorenzo, or as my crew calls me, Dio Del Mare - God of the Sea.
Quite the title...
Ha! It fits, I'm not just a pretty face. I possess the most powerful ship in the fleet. Though most people just see my charming smile and forget about that.
A nice smile won't get you everywhere.

Fields.MenuText: I guess you're... not bad looking.
So it's your picture they added to the dictionary. Next to the word "pompous."
I've seen angler fish with prettier smiles.

Fields.DialogueText: It's all right, you can say it. I'm gorgeous.
I've been called worse, but I like the humor. Very clever, Capitano.
Hahaha, well, much like an angler fish, I do captivate my prey.
Did you just wink at Bolzano?
I'm sorry, was that inappropriate?
Very. Keep both eyes open and up here when we're talking from now on, all right?
Enough of that. We have Morganas en route.
Fantastic! This is the perfect chance for me to see what this ship can do. You are protecting the Senator, after all. It should be impressive.
Feel free to stay. You'll see that he'll be in excellent hands.
@BATTLE
We have company! Get to your stations!
@BATTLE
Magnificent showing! I see why the Regia Marina chose you.
You might have the firepower, but we beat you in speed.
It's not a competition, you two.
Well, not anymore. You've already won.
Speaking of, I wanted to ask you about Fiorenza. She really wanted you to win. Any idea why?
I've had troubles in the past with manic fans. I'll be the first to admit that she took her obsession to a whole new level. I can't really blame her, though. I mean, look at me.
I still don't see it. Do you really have that many fans?
Too many to count. Trust me, I've tried. It gets tedious after a while, and faces all start to blend together.
Oh, what a sad life you must lead.
Wasn't Fiorenza sentenced to life in some prison somewhere? There's really no need to worry about her anymore.

Fields.MenuText: I'm not worried.
She deserves worse.
The guards better keep a close eye on her.

Fields.DialogueText: Confident as usual, Capitano.
That's dark, but I don't disagree after what she did to Nicolina.
I'm still cautious. She's a dangerous woman.
Silly me! I just realized I still haven't done what I came aboard to do. Congratulations on your victory, Capitano. I look forward to sharing the waters with you.
You're saying that like we've only just started sharing the waters. We've been in the same seas the entire time.
Of course. It's just a saying. Now, I must be going. I do have my own ship to attend to, after all.
Well... he's... I'm not sure what to say about him.
He must have trouble finding hats for such a big head.
That's an excellent way to put it.
Might I have a word, Capitano?
Of course.
What did you think about Lorenzo? He's quite the charmer, isn't he?

Fields.MenuText: All I can say for certain is that he lives up to his reputation.
I think he's trying a little too hard to be God's gift to the ocean.
He clearly gets by on his charm a lot, but those tricks aren't going to work on us.

Fields.DialogueText: He seemed like a good man to me. Certainly feeds his ego, but that's not necessarily a bad thing.
Trying hard isn't a bad thing. Sometimes it's the only way to get things done.
Tricks? Are you sure you aren't just seeing shadows where there aren't any?
Did you just want to gush about Lorenzo for a bit, or was there something else, Amadeo?
Yes. I wanted to remind you that Senator Giovanni arrives soon.
Right. We'd better prepare the ship for his arrival.
My thoughts exactly, Capitano!
*ALARM*
So much for that idea.
Who ever said war was convenient?
@BATTLE
He's here! Giovanni has arrived!
The day is finally here. Oh, it's just hitting me. I'm going to shake the hand of the Senator.
I'm glad you're so excited, Capitano. You earned this.

Fields.MenuText: Not alone. I had your help.
I did, didn't I? I worked hard for this.
You're right. He should be excited to meet me.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, shucks. You're gonna make me blush.
Well, I mean, I helped too.
All right, I think that might be going a little far.
Shhh, I can hear him coming!
Ciao! You must be the bold capitano I've heard so much about.
It is an honor, sir.
You're safe with us!
Wonderful, it has been a long journey. I think i'm going to help myself to dinner and retire for the night-
*ALARM*
I'm guessing that's not the dinner bell.
It's nothing for you to worry about, sir. We'll have it taken care of before dinner's been prepared.
@BATTLE
I'm glad to find you can handle yourself in battle, Capitano. I can see I have nothing to worry about while in your company.
Thank you, sir. I'm glad we could impress.
I have to ask... how come you didn't choose Lorenzo for this mission?
Capitano Lorenzo is a strong leader. He may be arrogant, but his ship is powerful enough to defend against attacks from sky and sea.
I'm hoping there's a "but" here?
No, there's not. The only reason I didn't choose Lorenzo for this mission was Fiorenza's betrayal.
Giving her everything she wanted after all that she did... the idea left an unpleasant taste in my mouth.
So if Fiorenza hadn't betrayed the Regia Marina?
The choice would've been simple, but what's done is done. I'm in need of a good rest. Good day to you both.
That's ironic. Fiorenza should've just had more faith, huh?
I should've known I wasn't his first pick.
Are you all right, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: I'm fine. I'm used to not being picked first.
I'm disappointed, but I can't let it get to me.
Is it all right if I curl into a ball and cry?

Fields.DialogueText: ... You wanna play some football or something? I'll pick you first.
We might not have been his first choice, but we were his final one. Focus on that.
No! That's not all right! That is not how a capitano should act!
*ALARM*
You know what that means.
It's still not the dinner bell.
@BATTLE
Capitano, you're not still sulking, are you?
I'm not sulking, I'm just... not happy. I can't stop comparing myself to Lorenzo now.
What? That's stupid. There's no comparison at all.
Yeah, I know. I'm in a distant second. His crew literally calls him God of the Sea. If it wasn't for Fiorenza, he'd be protecting the Senator. Not me.
Lorenzo's a joke. You're so much better than him, in, like, every way. If he was my capitano, I'm not sure how I'd get through the day without rolling my eyes right out of their sockets.

Fields.MenuText: Have you seen his hair, though? I'll never have hair like that.
Heh, you always know what to say to cheer me up, don't you?
You really mean that? You'd rather have me as your captain?

Fields.DialogueText: In my opinion, his hair is way too greasy. Bleh.
Well, if I can't cheer you up, who can?
Of course! I mean, I chose you in the first place after all.
You're right... I can't let this affect me so much. I have a senator to protect.
That's the Capitano I know and–
*ALARM*
Looks like I cheered up just in time for the fight.
The last thing we need in battle is a wet blanket. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Capitano! I received word this morning of an incident I believe you should be aware of.
An incident? I don't like the sound of that.
The prison holding Fiorenza fell under siege this morning. There were no survivors...
No survivors? So she's dead?
Her body wasn't found, but there was a lot of rubble. She could just as easily be-
No, she's alive. I'm sure she orchestrated some elaborate extraction. At the cost of more Regia Marina lives, it would seem.
We're on the same page then. You've had personal dealings with her. Do you have any idea how she could've done this?

Fields.MenuText: I had nothing to do with it, if that's what you're implying.
Well, she's familiar with bombs. Learned that the hard way.
It's not like we were best friends. You were something like her boss, right? Wouldn't you know her better?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sure you didn't. It never hurts to make sure, though.
Unless she knows how to make straw bedding and stones into explosives, I doubt she blew her way out.
I'm many people's boss. I don't know everyone that works under me personally.
If Fiorenza is behind this... then we need to anticipate her next move.
*ALARM*
Well, at least she has to deal with the Morganas, too. She shouldn't get very far.
@BATTLE
The news of Fiorenza's escape is rather unsettling, Capitano.
Yes, it is... but we have to keep our mind on the task at hand. We have a senator to escort.
In my eyes she's the bigger threat. Alone, she almost destroyed the ship. You should never underestimate the power of love.
Watch out! COMING THROUGH!
Again with the bicycle! You're going to kill me with that thing one day!
Don't be so dramatic! And use her name already. I know you know it.

Fields.MenuText: We've talked about this, Bolzano. Eyes open.
She may be a bit of a safety hazard, Amadeo, but you have to admit she's pretty fast.
Bolzano, don't make me regret fixing Nicolina.

Fields.DialogueText: Sorry, Capitano. I'll pay more attention next time.
The fastest in all the Italian Alps! Maybe even the world! Oh, I like the sound of that!
Nicolina and I know you don't really mean that, Capitano!
I think you owe Amadeo an apology.
Sorry! We'll try to give you a wide berth next time. Nicolina can just get a little carried away.
It scares me a little when you refer to that bicycle as if it was a living person.
You'll change your tune after we win the Tour de France.
Ha! That'll be the day.
Hmph! No faith. We'll show him someday, Nicolina.
*ALARM*
We've got Morganas. That's something you could win today, Bolzano.
Rude!
@BATTLE
And the time after that.
And the time after that...
Capitano, do you have a moment?
For you? Always. What do you want to talk about?
I've been training a lot lately. A lot. An excessive amount... but Amadeo thinks the idea of me competing in the Tour de France was ridiculous. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: I think you could do a whole lot more than just compete. You'd dominate.
This is your pressing question? We're fighting a war. Against alien battleships. That's a little more important than a bike race.
Amadeo has a point. The people who compete in the Tour de France are the best of the best.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, obviously. I'm glad you agree.
The Tour de France isn't just some bike race. It's THE bike race.
Which is exactly why I should be racing in it. Have you seen me? I'm the best of the best.
If it makes you happy, then we can always try to enter you into the Tour de France, all right? But only after the war is over.
Those are two things easier said than done. But I appreciate the thought, Capitano.
I just want to say-
Wait, I sense danger.
Morganas?
*ALARM*
What do you think?
@BATTLE
We have company! Get to your stations!
@BATTLE
Capitano, I was told you wanted to see me?
I just wanted you to come join me on deck. You spend too much time inside. A little ocean spray can do you wonders.
The taste of the ocean makes me sick.
But look how beautiful it is out here. How can something so gorgeous make you sick?
I feel about the ocean in a similar way that you feel about Capitano Lorenzo. It's nice to look at, but my gut doesn't agree with it.
And here I thought I knew everything there was to know about you.
You learn something new every day.
Hey, you guys having fun without me?
Actually, I was just leaving. Keep the Capitano company for me, would you, Bolzano?
Uh, sure. Happy to.
Seasick already, Amadeo?
Amadeo gets seasick?! Why are you in the navy, then?
Shut up...
He's funny. Always entertaining that one.
Really? I got the feeling that you two didn't like each other.
Maybe at first, but we've grown on each other. I mean, I grow on everybody. I'm adorable.

Fields.MenuText: Not everybody. I'm still on the fence.
You are just about the cutest thing I've ever seen.
I'm not sure he'd agree with that sentiment.

Fields.DialogueText: Psh, please. You love me. I'm sure that I'm your favorite.
I know, right? People love me. Even if it sometimes takes them a bit.
Oh, I see right through that act. Amadeo's a teddy bear deep down.
Did you hear that? Oh, Capitano! Look out!
*BOOM*
Oof...
... Bolzano? Are you all right?
I'm alive... I'm more worried about you.
You jumped in front of me. I'm alive because of you.
I'm... relieved to hear it... Capitano...
Stay with me, Bolzano!
Hey! Lorenzo's ship just fired on us!
Lorenzo's ship? We need to get ready for battle. Amadeo, get the ship's doctor. Bolzano was caught in the blast.
Belles are tough. She looks like she'll be okay.
It'll take a lot more than that to keep her down, but I want to be sure.
Of course, but... Lorenzo's preparing to board. You need to gather the crew.
Oh, I'll gather the crew alright. This won't go unanswered.
It's nice to be back on board!
Fiorenza?! What's the meaning of this!?
Lorenzo, my love, please silence il senatore.
Anything for you, my sweet.
Mmphm!!!
You wretched bastards!
I'm sorry we had to meet again under these circumstances, Capitano. Giovanni is simply too valuable to us. We couldn't just leave him in your hands.
Again, you've bitten off more than you can chew, Fiorenza. Leave the Senator here and run while you still have the chance.
Oh? You're trying to bargain now? You see my ship out there? One word from me and it'll send your darling little ship to the bottom of the sea.
So I'd watch you say if I were you.
I understand why you're doing this, Fiorenza. You're insane, but why are you helping her, Lorenzo?
That is none of your concern, Capitano. Our motives are our own.
I've already gotten in trouble once from talking too much. I learn from my mistakes. Now, I really must be on my way. Come, Giovanni!
Mmphm!!!
Capitano, Bolzano's being taken care of. She's still in recovery, but they seem to think she'll be fine.
That's good. For you, Lorenzo. You'd be bleeding out on the floor if the news were any worse.
You're taking this far too personally, Capitano. This is war. It's not like I was aiming for her.

Fields.MenuText: But you were. She's the ship, after all.
You talk like you know everything, but you don't even see that Fiorenza's just using you.
Big talk from a guy that can't fight fair. That shot was a sucker punch.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh... Well, I suppose I was aiming for her then.
My ocean pearl and I are in this together.
I can fight fair. It's just faster if I don't.
To prove I'm not a bad guy, I'm going to leave your ship intact. Not another shot will come from my ship.
*BOOM*
What was that?! You goddamn liar!
Calm that fury and redirect it. I said nothing about the approaching Morganas.
*ALARM*
You lured them here, didn't you?
Farewell. Have fun dealing with them while your Belle's trying to find her sea legs.
Bastard. I wish we could go after him, but we have to deal with Morganas first.
@BATTLE
Don't worry. Bolzano will be in fighting form quickly... I hope...
Hey, Capitano! Sorry I missed the last meeting. They keep telling me I need more rest.
You already look so much better. I'd listen to them, Bolzano. They seem to know what they're doing.
Oh, they're just being overly cautious. They're still getting used to how fast I can heal.

Fields.MenuText: So you think you're already back to a hundred percent?
Well, when it comes to you, I also want to be cautious. You're too important to risk.
Then let's get you out of here. I miss seeing you race around the ship on Nicolina.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yeah! I'm closer to, say, a hundred and ten percent.
Aw, you sure know how to make a girl feel special. If you kept that up, I'd be a lot less antsy about getting out of here.
That sounds so amazing! But I don't want to get tracked down and tranqed or whatever doctors do to runaway patients. I hear some stories.
How's the crew doing out there without me keeping a close eye on them?
Morale is low without you there to cheer everyone on, but we know what we have to do.
To get Giovanni back.
Exactly.
That's why you're the capitano. Always leading us to victory!
We just lost to Lorenzo.
Yeah, sure, we lost a battle, but we're going to win the war!
You mean with the Morganas?
No, I'm talking about the one with Lorenzo. The war within the war.
You're losing me.
I'm just trying to say you're a good leader. Take the compliment!
Just kidding around. Thanks, Bolzano.
Let's get to the bridge. We've got Morganas coming!
@BATTLE
Need me to carry you?
Ha! I'm strong enough to get there myself... but I'm tempted to lie just so that I can get a piggyback ride!
Capitano, I'm sorry to intrude, but I have something you should hear.
Hey, Amadeo! It's about time you come to visit me in here while the doctors keep fussing! I visited you in lockup, after all.
To glare at me.
Well, I thought you blew up Nicolina!
Amadeo, what is it?
News of Giovanni and his capture are all over the newspapers. Italy is in a panic.
Oooh, that's not good.
We're going to get him back. And Fiorenza and Lorenzo will spend the rest of their miserable lives far apart in two separate prisons on opposite sides of the country.
Yeah, that's right! Get all fired up, Capitano!
We need a plan of attack, Capitano. What's our first move?

Fields.MenuText: We can't let them go any further. We need to chase them down.
Sit and wait. They will come to us.
How well does Nicolina handle on the water?

Fields.DialogueText: That's what I'm talking about. A good chase is just what the doctor ordered!
That's your plan? And here I was getting all excited.
Not well, but maybe I can fashion some kind of flotation device!
Fiorenza said that Giovanni was valuable to them. She might be planning to demand a ransom.
That's certainly possible.
If that's the case, maybe our best plan would be to wait. It's their move now.
Great, more waiting. I just want to get back on Nicolina. I'll never get into the Tour de France at this rate.
Is that what you're thinking about at a time like this?
We all have dreams, Amadeo. Even Belles.
Yeah, Amadeo! Let me have my dreams!
*ALARM*
We don't have time for dreams. We have Morganas to fight.
@BATTLE
Oh, Capitano, I wasn't expecting to find you here.
In my office? Hardly seems like a surprise.
Well, you've been spending the majority of your free time in the company of Bolzano.
Well, someone has to keep her entertained. She's was dying of boredom stuck with all of that bed rest the doctors said was necessary.
So you're doing it for her?
Well, she's only there because she jumped in front of the blast to protect me, after all.
So you feel like you owe her? Is that all there is to it, or is there something else?
What are you getting at?
I'm just wondering... maybe you've got romantic yearnings for Bolzano, Capitano?

Fields.MenuText: No, that's ridiculous! Why would you suggest something like that?! Maybe you're the one with feelings for her!
I'm not really sure.
I might. Would that be so bad?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't you think you're protesting a little too much?
Well, I'd suggest you think about it.
Not at all. I just wanted to make sure you were aware of it.
You don't think you might be getting a little too personal here, Amadeo?
Maybe. I apologize. Just... something to think about.
Hmm... I suppose I will.
@BATTLE
The doctors finally set you free, Bolzano?
I finally convinced them they could leave me alone. They were still worried, but I think they were tired of my arguments.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I'm glad to have you back by my side full-time.
If you start to feel lightheaded or anything, be sure to let me know.
It took you long enough to get out of there. I was beginning to think you were just lazy.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad to be back. I was really missing all the fun.
Now you're worrying, too? I'm not made of porcelain. I'm probably stronger than you!
Me, lazy? You've got to be kidding. You can't be lazy with aspirations like mine!
Now, if you'll excuse me, I'd like to get a few laps in with Nicolina before we get rudely interrupted.
You mean by Morganas?
Actually, I was thinking about Amadeo... but sì, Morganas would disappoint me, too.
*ALARM*
Look what you did!
How am I responsible?
You talked about 'em. They must've heard. Come on, let's go take care of this so I can spend some quality time with Nicolina.
@BATTLE
We have a weak signal coming over the radio!
And Morganas coming over the horizon, Bolzano.
It's a repeating message, so let's deal with our enemies first.
@BATTLE
Finally. Is the signal still going?
Come listen for yourself.
*STATIC*
Boost the gain if you can. I can barely make anything out.
... Capitano... Care to chat? Giovanni is alive...
Fiorenza? Give me the radio!
Return the Senator, Fiorenza!
Ah, there you are, Capitano... I was worried you'd never get our signal.
What do you want, you dirty sea hag?
Sea hag? Impudent little girl. If you want to see him again... ten- no, twenty million lira will be the price.
You're out of your mind!
We'll chat soon. I suggest you be in a more charitable mood by then.
Capitano, we pinpointed their location. I suggest we call the Regia Aeronautica to rain hell from the sky.

Fields.MenuText: We'd be raining hell on the Senator too.
Destroy them all!
Tell them to disable the cannons so we can get close.

Fields.DialogueText: So maybe a little less hell. If they can just disable the cannons, we'll have a much better shot.
Wait, we need to save the Senator, remember. We should probably just have them disable the cannons instead, right?
Good plan, Capitano!
Send word to the air force. We'll be needing their assistance at Fiorenza's location.
Understood.
That's not a plan!
It's a start. We've got to do something.
As long as that something isn't just "run in and get ourselves killed." That won't save anyone.
What's all this arguing about?
The airstrike didn't work. Lorenzo blew them all out of the sky.
Really? Just like Giovanni said. Powerful enough to defend against attacks from sky and sea.
Lorenzo's ship is indeed powerful. Which is why we can't just rush in there.
All right, let's send another airstrike. See how well that works out for us.
That's not what I'm suggesting! But we need an effective plan before we do anything.

Fields.MenuText: We shouldn't move until we know what we're going to do.
We have their location. We can't just sit on our hands.
You both need to stop. Bickering isn't going to get us anywhere.

Fields.DialogueText: You too, Capitano? Fine...
Exactly, Capitano. We need to do something!
We're not bickering. This is... a tactical... argument?
*ALARM*
Morganas. At least we can agree on how to take them out.
They're a much more predictable enemy.
Predictable? So you anticipated them coming out of nowhere and declaring war on all mankind?
Well... No.
She got you there, Amadeo.
Nothing's predictable, you two. Mwah.
Did you just... kiss me?
Just being unpredictable. Now come on. We've got Morganas to deal with!
@BATTLE
Capitano, we need to talk.
What is it, Bolzano?
I know you spent every day with me while I was in the infirmary. I know how you feel.
How I feel?
Sì. How you feel about me.
My feelings for you are-
You don't think I can handle this anymore. You think I'm weak. I was down for too long and got soft. Right?
What?!
But I can do this, Capitano! Lorenzo may have the bigger guns, but I'm faster. I won't let him get a shot on me! And we can swoop in and save the Senator!

Fields.MenuText: I don't think you're weak.
For a second there, I thought you were going to confront me about my feelings.
I wouldn't agree to this plan, injury or not, Bolzano.

Fields.DialogueText: Then why aren't we rushing in to save the day? I feel like if I hadn't gotten hurt that's what we'd be doing.
I am. Your feelings about my injury. What other feelings would we be talking about?
Really? Because we've done some crazy and dangerous stuff in the past.
Do you really think I can't beat Lorenzo?
You can beat anyone and anything, Bolzano.
Then let's go after this greasy-haired monkey and rescue the damsel in distress!
If you're really as confident as you sound right now... let's go.
That's my capitano! I could kiss you right now! But I must prepare. We've got a big battle ahead of us...
Just don't get hurt. I can't afford to lose you, Bolzano...
@BATTLE
I don't think this is the right time for that.
Capitano!
Report.
Lorenzo's ship is trying to establish contact with us.
They must be wondering what we're doing here.

Fields.MenuText: I am not going to enjoy this conversation.
Maybe we should just let them keep wondering.
I don't know whom I'd rather have on the other end less... Fiorenza or Lorenzo.

Fields.DialogueText: You don't have to talk to them. We could always greet them the ol' fashioned way. Artillery.
Up until we're sinking their ship. I think then they'll get the idea.
Personally, I'd rather deal with Fiorenza. I honestly think, between the two of them, she's less crazy.
What do you think, Amadeo? Should I answer?
Only if you think you can keep it cordial. We may be able to get the first shot off if they think they're having a pleasant conversation.
There's nothing pleasant about talking to those crazies.
True, but it's worth a try.
Fiorenza? Do you copy, Fiorenza?
Ah! We meet again... What exactly were you hoping for when you came here, Capitano?
We were hoping to find a way to end this without bloodshed.
So you have our money?
You and I both know that twenty million lira is far too much for us to gather. Be reasonable.
Have you forgotten who I have here? This is Il senatore. Listen.
Help! Get me out of here, please!
I could get double for this frightened little man from any of our enemies. Twenty million doesn't seem like that all that much now, does it?
You're right... We'll get your money.
Yes, you will. And be quick about it before we change our minds.
*STATIC*
We're not really gonna give them that money, are we?
Of course not. Prepare to fire.
Are you sure about this, Capitano?
Bolzano?
We can do this, Capitano. Trust me.
We're doing this. And we're going to win.
@BATTLE
This is tougher than I thought it was going to be.
That's not what I want to hear in the middle of a battle, Bolzano. What's wrong?
Don't worry, Capitano. I can still handle this.
We're being joined by Morgana reinforcements.
Reinforcements? Did Fiorenza strike a deal with them?
Far more likely that they're just drawn to the sounds of battle.
Either way, they're going to further complicate things.

Fields.MenuText: We need to focus on dispersing the Morganas. Lorenzo will be easier to handle one on one.
We need to ignore the Morganas for now and bombard Lorenzo. He's the main threat.
Maybe now would be a good time to run...

Fields.DialogueText: Agreed, Capitano.
Damn straight he is. The Morganas have nothing on those cannons of his.
Run?! No! Bad Capitano!
*BOOM*
Look at that! Morganas are attacking Lorenzo's ship, too.
That's a relief!
Aren't you forgetting something? The Senator is still on that ship. We can't let the Morganas destroy it.
You're right. We need to disable the ship, not destroy it.
Then we can't delay. Dispatch the Morganas. Then we can deal with Lorenzo.
Up for the challenge, Bolzano?
I'm Bolzano! I can handle anything!
@BATTLE
Bravo, Capitano. I'm a big enough man to admit when I've been bested.
I'm not. This won't be the last you've seen of me. No prison can hold my ambitions.
We won't make the same mistake twice, Fiorenza. I'll see to your imprisonment personally. I have somewhere special for criminals like you. Both of you.
As long as we're together, my dear Fiorenza, we can overcome any hardships.
Which is why I'm sending one of you, just one, to our allies for your imprisonment. I just haven't decided which yet.
No, you can't do that!
Get them out of here.
No! You can't take my ocean pearl away from me!
I will find you, Lorenzo! We will be together again!
Ah! That was satisfying! Amazing, Capitano - I knew you had it in you.
After putting up with their nonsense all this time, it felt good to put them in their place.
Nonsense? I thought they were torturing you.
And I'll never have to see them again.

Fields.MenuText: I'm going to miss them a little.
Good riddance. I hope they rot in their cells.
What if they get out?

Fields.DialogueText: You're going to what?! They were horrible people! Are you crazy or something?
I still say she deserves worse for what she did to poor Nicolina.
If Senatore Giovanni says he can keep them in their cells, I believe him.
A pleasure to see you all again, but what I really need right now is to get some good shut-eye. If you'll excuse me.
If he's heading to bed, you might want to make sure they don't turn on the alarm. Morganas are approaching.
Thoughtful, Bolzano. Let's go...
You don't think he'll wake up from the sounds of gunfire?
@BATTLE
We've arrived, Senator, sir!
And in one piece!
The country owes you a massive debt. And my thanks.
Not too bad for your second choice, huh?
Especially considering your first choice kidnapped and tortured you.
Sì. If not for you, I would not be standing here today. If there's anything I can do for you, to return the favor, please just let me know.
Actually... you know, there is something you could do for Bolzano.
For me?
She's keen to be a competitor in the Tour de France. Think you could help her with that?
Capitano!
Bolzano is quite the athlete, but the situation is... tense with France at the moment. I'm not sure I can grant that now, but I promise you that after the war, we will find a way.
Really!? Thank you so much! I will make sure Nicolina is ready for action!

Fields.MenuText: I seriously doubt they're gonna let you ride that tank you call a bicycle, Bolzano.
I told you we could get you in somehow.
Seriously? That worked? Wasn't expecting that.

Fields.DialogueText: Shut up! A girl can dream!
Don't pretend like you were planning this all along, Capitano.
Of course it worked. Il senatore is a very kind, gracious man. And so handsome too!
I really must be going, but I'd love to have you both for dinner when I get back to Italy. I'm thinking Bolzano may be a fitting destination.
Are you talking about me? Or my namesake?
Heh, your namesake. It seems a fitting place as any to award the medal of bravery to the two of you.
Seriously? I don't know what to say.
Say you'll accept.
Of course I do.
Fantastic. Now wish me luck with this conference. Hopefully we'll be able to come to a few decisions regarding the Morganas.
Goodbye! Good luck with your super boring talks!
Bolzano, shush!
Heheh, they are boring, aren't they? Now those girls currently aiming their cannons at us, that's where the real excitement is.
@BATTLE
Hello, Capitano. It's a wonderful day today, is it not?
I suppose... Why are you smiling so much, Amadeo?
I'm just happy. The fighting has ceased. We've delivered Senatore Giovanni to his destination. Things are nice and calm.
I guess you're right. It has been a while since things were a little calm.
It's calm enough that one might, I don't know, consider sharing their feelings with the object of their affection.

Fields.MenuText: Amadeo, are you... coming on to me?
As subtle as you're being, I'm beginning to think you're talking about me.
This again? You just won't let it go, huh?

Fields.DialogueText: Haha! No! I was talking about you and Bolzano.
Perhaps. If I were... who would you confess your feelings to? Bolzano maybe?
Not until you do something about it. It's not that hard.
Since when did you decide to become Cupid?
Since I saw how you reacted to Bolzano's injury.
I never found true love in this life, Capitano. It's one of my biggest regrets. I'd rather you not share my regrets. Tell her how you feel.
*ALARM*
We're done talking about this, Amadeo.
For now.
@BATTLE
There's the greatest capitano ever!
You're just saying that because I got you into the Tour de France.
Well, we both know I can't actually race until we find a way to overcome my inability to travel more than a few meters from the ship - but I'm optimistic we'll overcome that someday.
It was all thanks to you, Bolzano.
We wouldn't have been there if you hadn't trusted me. Thanks for that, by the way.
I know better than to doubt you. You're the most impressive person I've ever met.
Stop trying to make me blush!

Fields.MenuText: You're cute when you blush.
Fine. I wouldn't want to make you feel uncomfortable.
Never. I'm just going to ply you with compliments until you can't stand it.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I'm just gonna be red all day today now!
Pffft. How considerate.
Well, two can play at that game, you good-looking smooth talker with pretty eyes.
Bolzano... would you like to go out with me? Let's have dinner together.
Are you asking me out, Capitano?
That's what I said.
I have feelings for you, Bolzano. I don't want to regret not telling you about them.
Really? Heh, that's funny.
Excuse me? Funny?
Funny because Amadeo just told me something similar. He didn't want me to have regrets.
I think he might've had the same conversation with both of us.
Ha! The sneaky snake...
So you never actually gave me an answer. Let's have it.
The answer is yes, of course! I'm totally head over heels for you!
*ALARM*
That was one hell of a declaration.
Ruined by the stupid Morganas.
It wasn't ruined. Not for me.
So... that means you feel the same way?
The exact same way.
I think I might freak out the crew a bit, but I'm not gonna be able to stop smiling during this battle.
@BATTLE
I love your optimism, Bolzano.
I knew you loved me... Hey, you also kicked Lorenzo's butt. We were awesome in that fight, weren't we?
What? Do I have something on my face?
No, it's just... you *are* still smiling.
Well, you're still with me.
